repnme.cdata!:
Kazakhstan - Financial Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Financial Sector Adjustment Loan (FSAL)
            in Kazakhstan. The FSAL program therefore focused on the
            following two key objectives: (1) improving the sector
            environment to reduce the operational risks and latent
            instability of even promising banks; and (2) dealing with
            old problem loans and problem banks that affected the entire
            sector. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned in the project were as follows: (i) a stable
            macro-economic framework is critical to the success of
            financial sector reform; (ii) preparation of an FSAL within
            the framework of a country's medium-term assistance
            strategy will contribute to the success of the project;
            (iii) financial reform strategy implemented in Kazakhstan
            proved its viability and may provide a useful model for late
            reforming Former Soviet Union (FSU) countries; (iv)
            independence of the Central Bank is a key factor in the
            success of the financial sector reform; (v) rapid response
            and timely delivery of Technical Assistance (TA) is very
            important to support FSAL implementation; and (vi)
            hyperinflation, which reduced financial assets and
            liabilities, and the low level of intermediation by the
            financial system, gave the government a window of
            opportunity to build institutions without making major
            disruptions in the intermediation function.

repnme.cdata!:
Kazakstan - Financial Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Loan
            Project (FSAL) is designed to support the financial sector
            reform program of the government and National Bank of
            Kazakstan.  Strengthening the financial sector will also
            underpin the overall program of stabilization and structural
            reforms and, in particular, the continued restructuring and
            recovery in the enterprise sector.  Moreover, the project
            will help meet external financing requirements and support
            the budget. The FSAL aims to advance the structural reform
            process by supporting critical reforms in the financial
            sector, notably, the establishment of a conducive
            environment for banking sector growth and the resolution of
            problem loans and problem banks.  The loan will be disbursed
            in two equal tranches, the first available on loan
            effectiveness, and the second six months later, dependent on
            satisfactory implementation of the reform program.
